info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 21 at 5:18AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...ICY PATCHES POSSIBLE ON SOME ROADS, SIDEWALKS, AND PARKING LOTS IN NORTH-CENTRAL AND NORTHEAST WISCONSIN THIS MORNING... Scattered light precipitation will overspread the area this morning. The precipitation should fall as mainly rain, though some wet snow could mix in near the Upper Michigan border. Temperatures fell below freezing across much of north-central and northeast Wisconsin overnight. So although air temperatures will be creeping upward throughout the morning, the ground may be a little slower to warm, which may result in some of the liquid freezing when it hits the ground. As a result, icy patches could develop on untreated roads until mid morning, at which point the ground should warm above freezing. Anyone heading outdoors or traveling across the area this morning should be alert for the possibility of icy patches on untreated roads, sidewalks, and parking lots. Use extra caution, and allow some extra time to reach your destination.
